Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of people who allegedly voted illegally, stating that there were "millions" of illegal votes.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that millions of people voted illegally.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that deducting the alleged illegal votes would result in the person making the claim winning the popular vote.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the person making the claim did not win the popular vote.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in this claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the popular vote outcome.
